/mnt/sh_flex_storage/home/zehanyu/repos/GPT-Paper/pdfs/cancer_review/Implementation of deep learning in liver pathology optimizes diagnosis of benign lesions and adenocarcinoma metastasis/crops_ordered/page_13/region_8_list.png
regions.text:
1. Hornick JL, Lauwers GY, Odze RD. Immunohistochemistry can
help distinguish metastatic pancreatic adenocarcinomas from
bile duct adenomas and hamartomas of the liver. Am J Surg
Pathol. 2005;29:381-389.

2. Ozaki K, Higuchi S, Kimura H, Gabata T. Liver metastases:
correlation between imaging features and pathomolecular envi-
ronments. Radiographics. 2022;42:1994-2013.

3. Park JH, Kim JHo. Pathologic differential diagnosis of
metastatic carcinoma in the liver. Clin Mol Hepatol.
2019;25:12-20.

4. Horn SR, Stoltzfus KC, Lehrer EJ, et al. Epidemiology of liver
metastases. Cancer Epidemiol. 2020;67:101760.

5. Mayer P, Dinkic C, Jesenofsky R, et al. Changes in the
microarchitecture of the pancreatic cancer stroma are linked
to neutrophil-dependent reprogramming of stellate cells and
reflected by diffusion-weighted magnetic resonance imaging.
Theranostics. 2018;8:13-30.

6. Selves J, Long-Mira E, Mathieu MC, Rochaix P, Ilie M.
Immunohistochemistry for diagnosis of metastatic carcinomas
of unknown primary site. Cancers (Basel). 2018:10:108.

7. Markl B, Fiizesi L, Huss R, Bauer S, Schaller T. Number of
pathologists in Germany: comparison with European countries,
USA, and Canada. Virchows Arch. 2021;478:335-341.

8. Metter DM, Colgan TJ, Leung ST, Timmons CF, Park JY. Trends
in the US and Canadian pathologist workforces from 2007 to
2017. JAMA Netw Open. 2019;2:e194337.

9. Jiang Y, Yang M, Wang S, Li X, Sun Y. Emerging role of
deep learning-based artificial intelligence in tumour pathology.
Cancer Commun (Lond). 2020;40:154-166.

10. Coudray N, Ocampo PS, Sakellaropoulos T, et al. Classi-
fication and mutation prediction from non-small cell lung
cancer histopathology images using deep learning. Nat Med.
2018;24:1559-1567.

ll. Echle A, Ghaffari Laleh N, Quirke P, et al. Artificial intel-
ligence for detection of microsatellite instability in colorectal
cancer-a multicentric analysis of a pre-screening tool for clinical
application. ESMO Open. 2022;7:100400.

regions.crop_image_path: /mnt/sh_flex_storage/home/zehanyu/repos/GPT-Paper/pdfs/cancer_review/Implementation of deep learning in liver pathology optimizes diagnosis of benign lesions and adenocarcinoma metastasis/crops_ordered/page_13/region_9_list.png
regions.text:
12. Kriegsmann K, Lobers F, Zgorzelski C, et al. Deep learning
for the detection of anatomical tissue structures and neoplasms
of the skin on scanned histopathological tissue sections. Front
Oncol. 2022;12:1022967.

13. Kriegsmann M, , Haag C, Weis C-A, et al. Deep learning for
the classification of small-cell and non-small-cell lung cancer.
Cancers (Basel). 2020:12:1604.

14. Kriegsmann M, Kriegsmann K, Steinbuss G, Zgorzelski C, Kraft
A, Gaida MM. Deep learning in pancreatic tissue: identification
of anatomical structures, pancreatic intraepithelial neoplasia,
and ductal adenocarcinoma. Int J Mol Sci. 2021:22:5385.

15. Steinbuss G, Kriegsmann M, Zgorzelski C, et al. Deep learning
for the classification of non-Hodgkin lymphoma on histopatho-
logical images. Cancers (Basel). 2021:13:2419.

16. Wang S, Yang DM, Rong R, Zhan X, Xiao G. Pathology image
analysis using segmentation deep learning algorithms. Am J
Pathol. 2019;189:1686-1698.

17. Alzubaidi L, Zhang J, Humaidi AJ, et al. Review of deep
learning: concepts, CNN architectures, challenges, applications,
future directions. J Big Data. 2021;8:53.

18. Kriegsmann M, Kriegsmann K, Steinbuss G, et al. Implemen-
tation of deep learning in liver pathology optimizes diagnosis
of benign lesions and adenocarcinoma metastasis [data], 2023.
https://doi.org/10.11588/data/YAZWJW, heiDATA, V1

19. Bankhead P, Loughrey MB, Fernandez JA, et al. QuPath: open
source software for digital pathology image analysis. Sci Rep.
2017;7:16878.

20. Bello I, Fedus W, Du X, et al. Revisiting ResNets: improved train-
ing and scaling strategies. Adv Neur In. 2021;34. https://arxiv.
org/abs/2103.07579

21. Tan M, Le Q. Efficientnet: rethinking model scaling for convo-
lutional neural networks. International conference on machine
learning. 2019;6105-6114. https://arxiv.org/abs/1905.11946

22. Kingma DP, Ba JA. A Method for Stochastic Optimization.
arXiv:1412.6980; 2014.

23. Betmouni S. Diagnostic digital pathology implementation:
learning from the digital health experience. Digit Health.
2021;7:20552076211020240.

24. Hofman P, Ilié M, Chamorey E, et al. Clinical and molecular
practice of European thoracic pathology laboratories during the
COVID-19 pandemic. The past and the near future. ESMO Open.
2021;6:100024.

25. Saldanha OL, Quirke P, West NP, et al. Swarm learning for
decentralized artificial intelligence in cancer histopathology.
Nat Med. 2022;28:1232-1239.

26. Shmatko A, Ghaffari Laleh N, Gerstung M, Kather JN. Artificial
intelligence in histopathology: enhancing cancer research and
clinical oncology. Nat Cancer. 2022;3:1026-1038.

27. Hauser K, Kurz A, Haggenmiiller S, et al. Explainable artificial
intelligence in skin cancer recognition: a systematic review. Eur
J Cancer. 2022;167:54-69.

28. Aresta G, Aratijo T, Kwok S, et al. BACH: grand challenge on
breast cancer histology images. Med Image Anal. 2019;56:122-
139.

29. Ehteshami Bejnordi B, Veta M, Johannes Van Diest P, et al. Diag-
nostic assessment of deep learning algorithms for detection of
lymph node metastases in women with breast cancer. JAMA.
2017;318:2199-2210.
